challengeName: Agon - Analytics Tool Integration NodeJS Code Challenge
detailedRequirements:
The customer has an analytics tool that provides a filter focused UI and visualizations that map funding processes. The solution is a Windows desktop application that is being converted to become more web-based in a separate stream of work.

We are currently building a web front-end for our analytics tool. In the final version it should have dashboard-like behavior, as it should be able to place multiple visualizations of the same dataset on a single screen. Besides these visualizations an important part of our analytic tool is the 'tv remote' to navigate through the data. To filter data we use structured natural language queries. By stacking multiple of these queries, users can filter the data, on which visualizations are created.  The client is also looking to include a visual programming editor that allows users to visually define/configure sentences that specify refinements and metrics.

Challenge Overview

In this challenge you are building a socket server using nodejs and connect it with provided UI prototype to produce a functional application.

The final deliverable solution will allow client perform the following :

  • - Create/Edit/Delete/View a template

  • - List/reorder/group templates

  • - Fill a template to generate filter

  • - Delete filter.

  • - Reorder/Group filters.

  • - Save/Update/Delete/Get Action trail

  • - Load/Group/Reorder action trails

If anything not clear in requirements please ask in forums.

Challenge Requirements

UI prototype and Application

  • - You are provided with HTML5 UI Prototype.

  • - You are provided with existing application built in past challenge that was built using an old UI prototype and addressed part of the requirements.

Framework and Modules

  • - You will use MEAN.io stack in this challenge.

  • - You will also build a simple socket.io server to exchange data between frontend and backend in real time.

    • - All connected clients will be updated in real time.

    • - All operations : create, update, get, getall, delete of information should be done via socket.io.

    • - We are not detailing in specs what communication we are doing via socket.io but everything should be updated in realtime as result of any changes in backend. i.e. if we create/delete template then the template list menu should be updated in real time. same thing for filters, and action trails.

  • - You are required to use open source node module such as async to deliver an organized code.

  • - Backend will mainly have two models :

    • - Template : created in Sentence/Template builder, represents a natural language query.

    • - Filter : represents a filled template query, the query comes with variables, the user can fill the variables in the template and store it as filter.

    • - Action Trial : represent a list of filters.

    • - You will build the backend around managing these three models, the provided application don’t have the ‘filter’ object defined, it store it directly inside the action trail in the ‘data’ field.

General Notes

  • - It is preferred to suggest better naming than the pages name in the provided UI prototype.

  • - You are allowed to restructure/redefine models/mongo schema.

  • - The existing application provided is using OLD UI prototype, it should be completely replaced by the provided UI prototype.

  • - It is up to you to use the existing application as basis for your work or build one from scratch, you will not use the API built in the app, you will replace it by socket server for communications with frontend.

  • - Add proper validation where needed in both frontend and backend when storing the data.

Consolidating Navigation

  1. - The current angularjs application in the UI prototype should be restructured to be a single page and multiple partials.

  2. - The navigation between partials should remain as currently done in the UI prototype.

  3. - Whenever navigating between any page/partial, any open popup/flyout should be closed by default.

Templates Requirements

Template Builder

  1. - Editor page /action.html#/editor called Sentence Builder or Template builder.

  2. - To navigate to this page from menu : open /action.html, Click on ‘Refine Context’ button, Click on filter icon next to ‘Refine Traces”, then select “Create Template”.

  3. - Refer to the Readme.txt in the provided UI prototype to understand how to construct sentences. Also screenshots under ‘docs’ folder show you a detailed verification screenshots of the steps needed to build a sentence.

Template Model

  1. - The current template model definition in the current application needs new field to store the order of templates.

  2. - data field might need to be updated to support multiple sentences.

  3. - It is OK if you want to make changes to the model structure.

  4. - Note that a part can be static or dynamic, we added new option to mark a part in a sentence to be a static or dynamic. This update is made in UI prototype, you can construct a sentence and double click on any part to see that option in the #76c3bd (this is a color) popup

    1. - Static: means that the selection made in the template can not be changed when the template is used in a later stage.

    2. - Dynamic: means that the selection made in the template can be swapped with other valid selections in a later stage.

  5. - You are provided with a document that explains what is a sentence made of. Basically the Custom Parts and Keywords are considered variables to be filled and modified while entities and entities properties are always static. Also note that a variable can be static or dynamic, in case it is static we cannot make changes to it.

Saving Templates

  1. - After constructing valid template/sentences clicking ‘Save’ will prompt user to provide a name for template, but that should only happen if the user constructed a valid sentence successfully.

    • - The template name is required.

    • - Clicking ‘save’ for existing template will prompt the template name popup with name populated, users can update the name if they want to.

  2. - ‘Validate’ button will validate the created sentence. It should follow the rules defined in the UI prototype for validation.

  3. - The backend will store template with following information :

    • - name : the text provided when user click on ‘Save’

    • - data : the sentences constructed in the editor

    • - sortOrder : any new template should have sortOrder = 1 so it is displayed in top of the template menu list. Properly a better solution is to store adjacent nodes in the list instead of storing the sortOrder as digit.

    • - group : default to null

  4. - On successful execution the template editor will remain opened with title changed from “New Template” to the template name stored.

    • - Inline template name editing should be supported same as done in “Create filter” screen.

  5. - Display success/fail message depends on the save execution as done in UI prototype.

Listing Templates

  1. - Templates are listed in the left side menu as shown in the Editor page. The list will be populated when user navigate to the page using “Refine Context” button from Action page.

  2. - Templates in the list can be re-ordered as shown in the UI prototype.

    • - The new order should be stored in backend.

  3. - User can add groups by clicking on Filter icon next to “Refine traces”, menu will popup with “create folder” option, this will add entry to top of menu, user will provide valid name and click checkmark to save the group.

    • - The operation should be update the backend.

  4. - Templates can be grouped inside created/existing folder/group.

    • - The grouping should be stored in backend.

  5. - Right click on template will give two options :

    • - Edit : will take user to edit the template in Sentence Editor.

    • - Delete : will delete the item from backend.

  6. - Right click on folder allows user to :

    • - delete folder

    • - rename folder

Open and fill in a single template

  1. - User can click on a template from template list menu to open and a fill template variables. Let’s call it “Create Filter” screen.

    • - The template will be loaded from backend.

  2. - Clicking on Edit in the template filler section will take user to edit template in Sentence Builder.

    • - The template will be loaded from backend.

  3. - The title in top of “Create Filter” screen should be inline editing as done in the UI prototype.

  4. - Filling a template should take into account static/dynamic option for each variable as explained above for static/dynamic concept.

  5. - No backend interaction here.

Saving filled templates as a filter

  1. - When a user completely filled in a template they can store the filter by clicking “OK”.

  2. - Filters will be stored in Action Trail.

    • - Action Trail is an application-state storage for the currently opened set of filters.

    • - All created filters in current session will be stored using angularjs as local storage.

    • - Action trail is the bottom left menu you see when opening “Action.html” page in UI prototype.

  3. The user will be prompted with a form to fill the filter information :

    • - Name: Short name to be shown in listing of Action Trail

    • - Description: Longer text to give the user some room to comment on what the filter does and why it was added.

    • - Sentence: This is the filled in template so we don’t need it in form, so remove it.

Action Trail Requirements

Action Trail menu in Action page

  1. - It is Action.html page in the provided UI prototype.

  2. - The action trail menu is the one at bottom of the left side menu with Action Trial title, we can refer to it as Action Trail menu or Filters List menu.

  3. - When opening the page it will loads the Action Trail stored in local storage of current session, you can use this module for this purpose https://github.com/grevory/angular-local-storage

  4. - It will also load all Action Trails stored in backend (we call backend Data store as well)

  5. - The red title in Action Trail menu represents the current Action Trail name.

    1. - If action trail not stored in backend then user ‘New Action Trail’ as title, double clicking on it will make it editable inline, user can change the name.

Action Trail Model

  1. - The current action trail model definition in the current application needs new field to store the order of templates.

  2. - The model definition will need update to support grouping filters and reordering.

  3. - It is OK if you want to make changes to the model structure.

List the filters in Action Trail

  1. - The filters will be loaded from Action Trail stored in the browser local storage.

  2. - 1st item is always “Load business process”, next items are the stored filters.

  3. - First line of a filter shows its name, second line its full sentence

  4. - The percentages are placeholders, for now, use 100% everywhere.

  5. - Filters in the Action Trail can be re-ordered by drag/drop as done in the UI prototype.

  6. - Filters in the Action Trail can be enabled/disabled by right click on the filter item.

  7. - Filters can be deleted from the Action Trial by clicking Right click and select Delete option.

Group filters in Action Trail

  1. - Grouped filters will have a single name, but multiple sentences. Use the filters names combination to generate a name, i.e. add colon between original names.

  2. - You can merge the groups by dragging filters to other filter or existing group.

  3. - Groups are recognized by the collapse/expand icon and  “group” label above the name.

  4. - Groups can also be re-ordered using drag/drop

  5. - Groups can be collapsed to hide sentences or expanded to show list of sentences as done in the UI prototype.

Save Action Trail to backend

  1. - Right click on Action Trial title (in red) will show option “Save to datastore”, clicking on it will store the action trail with filters on backend. Display a popup to show successful storage if happened.

  2. - The save operation will store the filters in the same order and grouping in the saved action trail.

Listing Action Trails from Backend

  1. - The notification icon that has a number (5) in Action Trail menu section in UI prototype represents number of Action Trails available in backend, clicking on it will open up a flyout that list all Action Trails stored in backend.

  2. - User can double click on Action Trail item to open and view associated filters in Action Trail listing menu.

    • - Red title will be updated to match the Action Trail name. Should be truncated if the name is long, tooltip should be added to Action Trial title.

    • - The filter list will be populated from the opened Action Trail.

  3. - User can click on the gear icon in the flyout, it will give option to create folder same as we do for grouping in Template listing as shown in the UI prototype.

    • - The operation should be update the backend.

  4. - Action trails can be reordered in the flyout by drag/drop as shown in the UI prototype.

    • - The reordering should be stored in backend.

  5. - Action trails can be grouped into folders by drag/drop as shown in the UI prototype.

    • - The grouping should be updated in backend.

  6. - Action trail item can be deleted by right click on an item, it will show delete option as shown in the UI prototype.

    • - The operation should be update the backend.

  7. - Folder can be deleted by right click on the folder, it will show delete option as shown in the UI prototype.

    • - The operation should be update the backend.

  8. - Folder can be renamed by right click on folder, it will show rename option as shown in the UI prototype.

    • - The renaming will be updated in backend.

Documentation

  • - Provide a detailed README documentation for how to setup and configure the application.

  • - Your code should be documented properly to be easily maintained by future developers.

Supported browsers

Your submission must work on the browsers listed below:

  • - IE10+

  • - Safari latest version on Mac & Windows

  • - Firefox latest version on Mac & Windows

  • - Chrome latest version on Mac & Windows
finalSubmissionGuidelines:
Deliverable

  • - All source code that implement the requirement.

  • - README in markup language

  • - Verification document contains steps to verify your solution
